full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 775 Filed 08/10/22 Page 12 of 16 3158 LCSCMAXT

1 THE COURT: I am -- yes, go ahead, Ms. Moe.
2 MS. MOE: We're just going to add that the government agrees that the Court has the discretion to set a schedule for deliberations. Absent a hardship, I think the schedule the Court has proposed is entirely reasonable under the circumstances.
3
4 THE COURT: Here's what I'll do. I'll do what I just indicated today for through the week, and if we don't have a verdict tomorrow, I'll say through the weekend.
5
6 MR. PAGLIUCA: That makes sense to me, your Honor.
7
8 THE COURT: In each case, I am couching it with, they have the option to indicate if it's a hardship due to unmoveable commitments.
9
10 MR. PAGLIUCA: That's a good suggestion, your Honor. That's fine with us.
11
12 THE COURT: Ms. Moe.
13 MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor. Thank you.
14
15 THE COURT: Let me tell you exactly what I plan to say so you can tell me if you wish anything different.
16
17 First, I'll just go over the schedule and COVID protocols, which the district executive has asked me to remind, in light of the variant. And I'll continue to urge caution as I have been. And then I'll say, as to schedule going forward, we are going to continue with the same daily schedule as today, that is to say 9:00 a.m. to at least 6:00 p.m. Please let me
18
19 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
20 DOJ-OGR-00017345
